text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BeDiagnosticImagingPrescription 0..*BeModelReferralPrescription
BeReferralPrescription 1..1BeModelReferralPrescriptiontest
relevantClinicalInformation[x] 0..*Relevant information in the context of this prescription concerning for example allergies, kidney function, diabetic. When detailed information can be given, it is RECOMMENDED to express it as structured as possible.
relevantClinicalInformationAnnotationAnnotation
relevantClinicalInformationCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
relevantClinicalInformationReferenceReference(Procedure | Condition | Observation | AllergyIntolerance | MedicationStatement)
diagnosticQuestion[x] 0..*Either in text or in a coded format. At the discretion of the prescribing party.
diagnosticQuestionAnnotationAnnotation
diagnosticQuestionCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
contraIndication[x] 1..*Relevant information in the context of this prescription concerning possible contra indication. For example presence of devices or (suspected) pregnancy. When detailed information can be given, it is RECOMMENDED to express it as structured as possible. If prescriber has no knowledge of contra indication, this SHALL be expressed with a 'ASKU' nullFlavor ( = Information was sought but not found ) in codeableConcept.
contraIndicationCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
contraIndicationAnnotationAnnotation
contraIndicationReferenceReference(Device | Condition | Observation | MedicationStatement | AllergyIntolerance)
supportingInformation[x] 0..*BackboneElementtest
questionnaireResponse 0..*Reference(QuestionnaireResponse)Questionnaire responses
document 0..*Reference(DocumentReference)Any document added as extra information
imagingStudy 0..*Reference(ImagingStudy)If vital to this request, references may be given to previous diagnostic imaging
bodySite 0..*CodeableConceptbodySite, e.g. using a SNOMED-CT code
proposedInvestigation 0..*CodeableConceptWhat to do - coded or as text within the codeableConcept
contrastFluid 0..1codeifNecessary|notPermitted

Documentation for this format

name: BeDiagnosticImagingPrescription
description: Logical model describing the model for the diagnostic imaging prescription. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

element.definition: Logical model describing the model for the diagnostic imaging prescription. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

element.short: When this prescription was created
element.definition: When this prescription was created

element.short: The person who is responsable for the content, not necessarily the person who entered the content. This is either the prescriber, a co-prescriber or a performer
element.definition: The person who is responsable for the content, not necessarily the person who entered the content. This is either the prescriber, a co-prescriber or a performer

element.short: The prescribing healthcare party
element.definition: The prescribing healthcare party

element.short: Number of co-prescribers that must sign the prescription to activate it
element.definition: Number of co-prescribers that must sign the prescription to activate it

element.short: Information about co prescribers
element.definition: Information about co prescribers

element.short: The co-prescriber party
element.definition: The co-prescriber party

element.short: Type of the practitioner
element.definition: Type of the practitioner

element.short: Status of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)
element.definition: Status of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)

element.short: Type of mandatory for the signature of the co-prescriber (1= required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign to make the prescription valid, 2= conditionally required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign if the number of co-prescribers with a signature is lower than the number in co-prescriber number 3= optional: the signature does not affect the validity of the prescription, but is for information only
element.definition: Type of mandatory for the signature of the co-prescriber (1= required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign to make the prescription valid, 2= conditionally required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign if the number of co-prescribers with a signature is lower than the number in co-prescriber number 3= optional: the signature does not affect the validity of the prescription, but is for information only

element.short: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.
element.definition: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.

element.short: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available
element.definition: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available

element.short: An identifier for the Prescription Search Support
element.definition: An identifier for the Prescription Search Support

element.short: Reason for not following the PSS suggestion
element.definition: Reason for not following the PSS suggestion

element.short: An identifier for the bundle this prescription belongs to.
The type of bundle can be indicated in the type of the identifier
The original request or prescription triggered this prescription
element.definition: The original request or prescription that is the reason for this request - for example when a detailed request is created by a broader request.

element.short: Period of validity of prescription
element.definition: Period of validity of prescription

element.short: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution
element.definition: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution

element.short: The latest moment to end this treatment
element.definition: The latest moment to end this treatment

element.short: The prescription must have left the draft status before
element.definition: The prescription must have left the draft status before

element.short: The intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality
element.definition: The intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality

element.short: A reference to the provider party (e.g. a NIHDI number for a healthcare professional, a SSIN or only a displaystring for a non professional caregiver,...)
element.definition: A reference to the provider party (e.g. a NIHDI number for a healthcare professional, a SSIN or only a displaystring for a non professional caregiver,...)

element.short: The required discipline of the provider party
element.definition: The required discipline of the provider party

element.short: Start and enddate for the particular provider
element.definition: Start and enddate for the particular provider

element.short: Reference to an organization that will add the performer
element.definition: Reference to an organization that will add the performer

element.short: The current prescription should be performed after this one
element.definition: The current prescription should be performed after this one

element.short: What is prescribed
element.definition: What is prescribed

element.short: The problem (code or reference) that is the main reason for this prescription
element.definition: The problem (code or reference) that is the main reason for this prescription

element.short: Care Set Problem
element.definition: Care Set Problem

element.short: True if the prescriber wants feedback. Other caregivers can be mentioned in the note
element.definition: True if the prescriber wants feedback. Other caregivers can be mentioned in the note

element.short: Current status
element.definition: Current status

element.short: Reason current status
element.definition: Reason current status

element.short: Status of the treatment
element.definition: Status of the treatment

element.short: Reason treatment status
element.definition: Reason treatment status

element.short: Place where the treatment should be executed
element.definition: Place where the treatment should be executed

element.short: Anatomical place where the treatment should be executed
element.definition: Anatomical place where the treatment should be executed

element.short: Side of the body
element.definition: Side of the body

element.short: Additional text notes about the request.
element.definition: Additional text notes about the request.

element.short: Proposal, Prolongation, Prescription
element.definition: Proposal, Prolongation, Prescription

element.short: test
element.definition: test

element.short: Relevant information in the context of this prescription concerning for example allergies, kidney function, diabetic. When detailed information can be given, it is RECOMMENDED to express it as structured as possible.
element.definition: e.g. stomach ache during 10 days, echo suspected damage kidneys, complaints of patients, allergies,...

element.short: Either in text or in a coded format. At the discretion of the prescribing party.
element.definition: e.g. Cyste? Metastasis?

element.short: Relevant information in the context of this prescription concerning possible contra indication. For example presence of devices or (suspected) pregnancy. When detailed information can be given, it is RECOMMENDED to express it as structured as possible. If prescriber has no knowledge of contra indication, this SHALL be expressed with a 'ASKU' nullFlavor ( = Information was sought but not found  ) in codeableConcept.
element.definition: e.g.pregnancy, devices, kidney functioning

element.short: test
element.definition: test

element.short: Questionnaire responses
element.definition: Questionnaire responses

element.short: Any document added as extra information
element.definition: Any document added as extra information

element.short: If vital to this request, references may be given to previous diagnostic imaging
element.definition: If vital to this request, references may be given to previous diagnostic imaging

element.short: bodySite, e.g. using a SNOMED-CT code
element.definition: bodySite, e.g. using a SNOMED-CT code

element.short: What to do - coded or as text within the codeableConcept
element.definition: What to do - coded or as text within the codeableConcept

element.short: ifNecessary|notPermitted
element.definition: ifNecessary|notPermitted
